column2: MISSOURI DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column8: a speed limit sign.

column2: 2. The Department will mail you a reminder to renew before your license expires. The reminder will be sent to:
column4: the mailing address on your driver record.
column6: your previous address and your current one.
column8: the address on your last application.

column2: 3. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column8: on narrow roads.

column2: 4. This sign tells drivers that:
column8: left and right turns are not allowed.
column10: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 5. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column8: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 6. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column6: The car approaching from the left.
column8: The car approaching from the right.
column10: The car that is traveling faster.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column8: Side road

column2: 9. A “No Right On Red” sign means:
column4: When the traffic signal is red, you must turn right
column6: You do not have to come to a stop unless the traffic signal is red
column8: If the signal is red, you cannot turn right

column2: 10. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 11. The yield sign means:
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column10: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 12. This sign means:
column8: Traffic signal ahead
column10: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 13. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column8: slow down.

column2: 14. The yield sign means:
column4: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column6: The traffic light will soon be red.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.
column10: Drive with caution in wet weather.

column2: 15. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: show which lanes you must use.
column8: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 16. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
17. SATOP is an abbreviation for:
column8: Substance Abuse Traffic Offender Program.

column2: 18. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 19. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 20. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column10: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.

column2: 21. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column8: closetailing.

column2: 22. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 23. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column6: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column8: you must do it.
column10: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 24. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column8: Pedestrians may turn right.
column10: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.

column2: 25. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column6: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column8: be ready to shift to lower gear.
